events.description: London’s FTSE 100 fell 0.3% to around 10,280 points on Friday, extending previous losses.

events.event_name: Rio Tinto and Glencore Merger Collapse
events.description: Reports emerged that merger talks between Rio Tinto and Glencore had collapsed after more than a decade of pursuit.
Iran and the US began nuclear talks in Oman.

facts.fact_text: The FTSE 100 fell 0.3% to approximately 10,280 points on Friday.

evidences.evidence_text: London’s FTSE 100 fell 0.3% to around 10,280 points on Friday

facts.fact_text: RELX shares decreased by more than 4%.

evidences.evidence_text: Data analytics group RELX slid more than 4%

facts.fact_text: Glencore requested a 40% stake in the proposed combined entity with Rio Tinto.

evidences.evidence_text: Glencore... was said to have pushed for a 40% stake in the combined entity

claims.claim_text: Artificial Intelligence is expected to disrupt the business models of data and software companies.

evidences.evidence_text: growing concerns that AI could disrupt their business models

claims.claim_text: Glencore's demand for a 40% stake was the primary reason for the merger talk failure.

evidences.evidence_text: a demand that ultimately derailed discussions

claims.claim_text: Higher oil prices provided support for energy stocks to outperform the market.

evidences.evidence_text: energy stocks outperformed the broader market, supported by higher oil prices

evidence.evidence_text: data and software stocks leading the losses amid growing concerns that AI could disrupt their business models
Mining stocks came under additional pressure as copper and iron ore prices weakened
supported by higher oil prices after Iran and the US began nuclear talks in Oman
energy stocks outperformed the broader market, supported by higher oil prices
